channel.title: Combustible Brains
channel.itunes:subtitle: Combustible Brains
channel.itunes:author: Pranav Bhatkhande and Raa
channel.itunes:summary: Combustible Brains is a podcast where all is fair game, as long as we find appeal in it. We're a bunch of enthusiasts of technology, martial arts, motorcycles and coffee beans. Expect no less in any episode.
channel.description: Combustible Brains is a podcast where all is fair game, as long as we find appeal in it. We're a bunch of enthusiasts of technology, martial arts, motorcycles and coffee beans. Expect no less in any episode.
channel.googleplay:author: Pranav Bhatkhande and Raa

item.title: Indians Banning Chinese Apps
item.itunes:title: Indians Banning Chinese Apps
item.itunes:author: Pranav Bhatkhande and Raa
item.itunes:subtitle: Indians Banning Chinese Apps
item.itunes:summary: Today we're talking about the Indians banning Chinese apps in response to the current India-China situation. We then talk about how you can best protect your privacy using pragmatic tools like Signal.
item.description: Today we're talking about the Indians banning Chinese apps in response to the current India-China situation. We then talk about how you can best protect your privacy using pragmatic tools like Signal.

item.title: Brave New World
item.itunes:title: Brave New World
item.itunes:author: Pranav Bhatkhande and Raa
item.itunes:subtitle: Brave New World
item.itunes:summary: In this episode, we get a little philosophical as we walk through Aldous Huxley's best work - Brave New World, we then compare and contrast this dystopian paraside to our own, Huxley wrote this in 1932 and looking back today, one might say he was right. We discuss on what it means to be free, and if we're just cogs in the wheels of society.
item.description: In this episode, we get a little philosophical as we walk through Aldous Huxley's best work - Brave New World, we then compare and contrast this dystopian paradise to our own, Huxley wrote this in 1932 and looking back today, one might say he was right. We discuss on what it means to be free, and if we're just cogs in the wheels of society.

item.title: Zucktard, and the Metaverse of Stupidity
item.itunes:title: Zucktard, and the Metaverse of Stupidity
item.itunes:author: Pranav and Raa
item.itunes:subtitle: Zucktard, and the Metaverse of Stupidity.
item.itunes:summary: In this episode, we talk about the newly revealed re-brand of Facebook as Meta, as a part of Mark Zuckerberg's grand vision of metaverse. Its supposed to be a shared virtual universe where we can all meet and hangout, similar to the concept shown in the movie Ready Player One.
item.description: In this episode, we talk about the newly revealed re-brand of Facebook as Meta, as a part of Mark Zuckerberg's grand vision of metaverse. Its supposed to be a shared virtual universe where we can all meet and hangout, similar to the concept shown in the movie Ready Player One.

item.title: Bonjour, my little electric skateboard
item.itunes:title: Bonjour, my little electric skateboard
item.itunes:author: Pranav and Raa
item.itunes:subtitle: Bonjour, my little electric skateboard
item.itunes:summary: Electric cars are the rage, Elon Musk is the richest man in the world, the Chinese carmakers are slowly controlling the world's rare minerals supply, we have a casual chat about these trivial issues.
item.description: Electric cars are the rage, Elon Musk is the richest man in the world, the Chinese carmakers are slowly controlling the world's rare minerals supply, we have a casual chat about these trivial issues.

item.title: Computers get sophisticated STDs, just like you!
item.itunes:title: Computers get sophisticated STDs, just like you!
item.itunes:author: Pranav and Raa
item.itunes:subtitle: Computers get sophisticated STDs, just like you!
item.itunes:summary: Today we talk about Stuxnet, a sophisticated virus designed to cause real damage, in this episode we also talk about other cyberattacks that Governments these days love. Finally, if you have feedback for us, you can write that email and throw it away, because we don't have a feedback line yet.
item.description: Today we talk about Stuxnet, a sophisticated virus designed to cause real damage, in this episode we also talk about other cyberattacks that Governments these days love. Finally, if you have feedback for us, you can write that email and throw it away, because we don't have a feedback line yet.

item.title: Blue Balled By Communism
item.itunes:title: Blue Balled By Communism
item.itunes:author: Pranav and Raa
item.itunes:subtitle: Blue Balled By Communism
item.itunes:summary: In this episode we touch on how evil empires now control one of the most important minerals required for making electric cars a reality, as we move to a cleaner and greener future, we must understand the evil forces that might ultimately shape the world we envision. Let's build technology to go Cobalt free!
item.description: In this episode we touch on how evil empires now control one of the most important minerals required for making electric cars a reality, as we move to a cleaner and greener future, we must understand the evil forces that might ultimately shape the world we envision. Let's build technology to go Cobalt free!

item.title: Your Cousin Is A Whiny Socialist
item.itunes:title: Your Cousin Is A Whiny Socialist
item.itunes:author: Pranav and Raa
item.itunes:subtitle: Your Cousin Is A Whiny Socialist
item.itunes:summary: First we rant, and then we talk about the antiwork movement on reddit, captured on https://www.reddit.com/r/antiwork/. I'm too bored to write a longer description, so listen to the podcast instead.
item.description: First we rant, and then we talk about the antiwork movement on reddit, captured on https://www.reddit.com/r/antiwork/. I'm too bored to write a longer description, so listen to the podcast instead.

item.title: An Era Of Hexadecimal Intelligence
item.itunes:title: An Era Of Hexadecimal Intelligence
item.itunes:author: Pranav and Raa
item.itunes:subtitle: An Era Of Hexadecimal Intelligence
item.itunes:summary: A google engineer recently posted about a machine being sentient and got prompty fired for it. Here we dig in and find out if the era of machines is upon us already.
item.description: A google engineer recently posted about a machine being sentient (alive?) and got prompty fired for it. Here we dig in and find out if the era of machines is upon us already. We discuss what it means to be sentient and alive. We also recommend you read this article https://cajundiscordian.medium.com/is-lamda-sentient-an-interview-ea64d916d917

item.title: We do some unplanned social commentary!
item.itunes:title: We do some unplanned social commentary!
item.itunes:author: Pranav and Raa
item.itunes:subtitle: We do some unplanned social commentary!
item.itunes:summary: We planned to make an episode on how to securely upload pictures (we promise to still do this episode), but ended up talking about society, social media, and the modern world.
item.description: We planned to make an episode on how to securely upload pictures (we promise to still do this episode), but ended up talking about society, social media, and the modern world.

channel.item:
Sir, your social media salad is ready for pickup Sir, your social media is ready for pickup Pranav and Raa
Sir, your social media salad is ready for pickup
Instagram is slowly turning the knobs on its app to take on Tiktok, the biggest video platform in the world. In order to take on the Chinese giant, Instagram must make its app video first, and they're on it, the question is - will it work?
Instagram is slowly turning the knobs on its app to take on Tiktok, the biggest video platform in the world. In order to take on the Chinese giant, Instagram must make its app video first, and they're on it, the question is - will it work? Link to the NYtimes article we refer to - https://www.nytimes.com/2021/12/05/business/media/tiktok-algorithm.html
